statements: SELECT * FROM customer_segmentation_analysis WHERE age > 30;
SELECT customer_name, segment_category FROM customer_segmentation_analysis WHERE gender = 'Male';
SELECT customer_id, segment_category FROM customer_segmentation_analysis WHERE age < 40 AND gender = 'Female';
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, age FROM customer_segmentation_analysis WHERE segment_category = 'Premium';
SELECT * FROM customer_segmentation_analysis WHERE age >= 25 ORDER BY customer_name DESC;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, age, gender, segment_category FROM customer_segmentation_analysis WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY customer_name ASC
SELECT customer_name, age, segment_category FROM customer_segmentation_analysis WHERE gender = 'F' ORDER BY age DESC
SELECT * FROM customer_segmentation_analysis WHERE segment_category IN ('High Income', 'Middle Income') ORDER BY age ASC, customer_name DESC
SELECT customer_name, segment_category FROM customer_segmentation_analysis WHERE age <= 25 AND gender = 'M'
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, age, gender, segment_category FROM customer_segmentation_analysis ORDER BY segment_category ASC, age DESC
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, age FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE email LIKE '%@gmail.com';
SELECT * FROM transactions ORDER BY amount DESC;
SELECT customer_name, count(transaction_id) AS transaction_count FROM customers JOIN transactions ON customers.customer_id = transactions.customer_id GROUP BY customers.customer_id;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY customer_name DESC;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id IN (1, 3, 5) ORDER BY customer_name;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, age, email FROM customers WHERE age BETWEEN 25 AND 40 ORDER BY age DESC, customer_name ASC;
SELECT c.customer_name, t.transaction_date, t.amount FROM customers c JOIN transactions t ON c.customer_id = t.customer_id WHERE t.amount > 1000 ORDER BY t.amount DESC;

SELECT c.customer_name, COUNT(t.transaction_id) AS total_transactions FROM customers c LEFT JOIN transactions t ON c.customer_id = t.customer_id GROUP BY c.customer_name HAVING total_transactions > 3;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, customer_age FROM customers WHERE customer_gender = 'Male';
SELECT customer_name, customer_age, customer_gender FROM customers ORDER BY customer_age DESC;
SELECT customer_name, purchase_date, product_name, quantity, price FROM purchases WHERE price > 50;
SELECT segment_id, segment_name FROM segments;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_age > 30 ORDER BY customer_name ASC;
SELECT customer_name, customer_age FROM customers WHERE customer_gender = 'Male' ORDER BY customer_age DESC;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(*) AS purchase_count FROM purchases GROUP BY customer_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

SELECT customer_name, product_name, price FROM customers JOIN purchases ON customers.customer_id = purchases.customer_id WHERE customers.customer_age < 40 AND purchases.price > 100 ORDER BY price DESC;
SELECT segment_name, COUNT(*) AS segment_count FROM segments JOIN customers ON segments.segment_id = customers.customer_id GROUP BY segment_name ORDER BY segment_count DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers
SELECT customer_name, city FROM customers WHERE age > 30
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE city = 'New York'
SELECT * FROM transactions ORDER BY amount DESC
SELECT product_name, price FROM products WHERE category = 'Electronics'
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, email, age FROM customers WHERE city = 'New York';
SELECT customer_name, email, age FROM customers ORDER BY age DESC;
SELECT * FROM transactions WHERE amount > 1000;
SELECT segment_name, description FROM segments ORDER BY segment_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers LIMIT 5;
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name FROM customers WHERE birthdate > '1990-01-01';
SELECT * FROM orders ORDER BY total_amount DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT product_name, price, category FROM products WHERE category = 'Electronics';
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(order_id) AS order_count FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id HAVING COUNT(order_id) > 2;
SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY customer_id DESC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 10;
SELECT customer_id, first_name, last_name, birthdate FROM customers WHERE birthdate BETWEEN '1980-01-01' AND '1990-12-31';
SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, p.product_name, p.price FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id JOIN products p ON o.total_amount < 100;
SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, s.segment_name FROM customers c JOIN segments s ON c.first_name = s.criteria;
